entry.head: Lancaster, Duchy and C. P. of See Clerk of the Peace.
Land and Sea Officers See Daths of Supremacy and Allegiance.

tr.td: Statute 20 Car. II. c.5. revived for 3 Years, &c. from 24th June 1685.
Statutes 20 Car. II. c.5. and 1 Jac. II. c.13. revived for 7 Years.

What shall be made Leather Ware within Stat. 1 Jac. II. c. 22. § 29.
Stat. 1. Jac. II. c. 13. continued for 7 Years, 1 Ann. St. 2. c. 13. § 1.Mayors, & c. to obey 1 Jac. II.c. 22. –9 Ann. c. 11. § 11. and see § 36. of that Act. –Stat. 1. Jac. II. c. 22. extended to every Part of Great Britain. —24 G. III. Sess. 2. c. 19. § 22. but see Note to § 4. inf.
The Power of the Master, &c. of the Curriers Company to search for Leather.
Red Tanned Leather how bought and sold.

Buying and selling Leather by Weight lawful.
This Act explained by 12 G. II. c. 25. but 1 Jac. II. c. 22. or so much thereof as remained unrepealed (for which see 12 G. II. c. 25. § 7.) repealed by 48 G. III. c. 60. § 1. See Note to § 1. sup.

entry.head: The Liberties of the Subject declared See The Crown.

tr.td: Arundel Ground, building into Tenements, and Remainder of.
Bangor, for Repair of Cathedral Church, Maintenance of Choir, and Augmentation of Revenue of Bishoprick; for Augmentation of several Vicarages within the Comportions of Landinum in the said Diocese.

Bedford Level, for repealing a Clause in, 15 Car. II. c. 17.
See 7 G. III. c. 53. –19 G. III. c. 34.
Christ Church, Surrey, Rates for maintaining Minister, and finishing the Parish Church.
Mistakes in Act for settling, cleared.
Dungton North Chapel Chapelries, dividing from Petworth, &c.
Gloucester City, Court of Conscience erecting.
Hameldon, Rutland, Manors and Lands in, settled.
Hudson's Bay Company, Trade and Privileges confirmed.
Loleworth alias Lollworth, Co. Cambridge, Sale of Manor, &c.
Marlborough, Town of, covering Houses with Thatch, &c. prohibited.
Marlow, Great (Bucks), Sale of Mansionhouse and Manor of.
Newcastle upon Tyne, Court of Conscience erecting.
United Parishes of St. Michael Royal and St. Martin's in the Vintry, London, Grant by Rector of Part of St. Martin's Church Yard, confirmed.
Westminster, building Parish Church of St. Anne, and erecting Parish of St. James.
Westonbury, Chapel of, for making a distinct Church from Bangor.

entry.head: London Bridge Water Company See London, City of.

tr.td: Judgment of the Court of King's Bench upon a Quo Warranto against the Mayor, &c. of London, in Trinity Term, 35 Car. II. and all other Judgments against the Rights of London, void.
Vacates to be entered upon the Rolls.
Mayor, &c. to remain a Corporation, and to enjoy the Rights which they had at the time of the said Judgment.
Grants, Charters, &c. by Car. II. and Jac. II. touching the said Rights, since the said Judgment, void.
But Persons not having duly qualified to act upon the said Charters, liable to Penalties.
Recoveries, &c. in the Mayor's Court, &c. since the said Judgment, good.
Officers, so being at the Time of the said Judgment, confirmed, (Exception).
And Officers chosen, &c. since the said Judgment, confirmed.
Leases, &c. of Lands, &c. of the Corporation, made since the said Judgment, good.
Judgments, &c. obtained by Trustees for Lands, &c. of the said Corporation, to remain in force.
Freedoms obtained since the said Judgement, good.
The present Mayor, &c. to continue till new Election.
New Election of Mayor, Sheriffs, and Chamberlain to be made 26th May 1690; of the Common Council, 10th June 1690.

Lord Mayor to be presented and sworn in the Exchequer, 9th Nov. after every annual Election, 24 G.II.c.48. §11.and the Admission and Swearing of the Lord Mayor at Guildball to be on the 8th of Nov. instead of the 28th Oct. 25 G.II.c.30. §4.
If such Elections not so made, the said Officers in being at the time of the said Judgment to continue till new Election.
Persons so restored or continued to take the Oaths required by Stat. 1 W. & M. c.8.
Mayor, &c. to be sworn in as usual.
Surrenders and Charters for new Incorporations, by Car. II. and Jac. II. since the said Judgment, void.
Proviso against Prosecutions for acting thereon.
Leases, &c. by the said Companies, since the said Judgment, good.
Freedom of the said Companies good.
This Act to be taken as a Public Act.
For Relief of the Orphans and other Creditors.
The City Lands charged with £8,000. per Ann. for the Orphans, except certain Hospitals.
Grant of Lights for 21 Years, for £600 per Ann. to Persons in this Act named.
Appropriation of the Money during and after the Term.
Books thereof kept and inspected without Fee.
Wardens of Companies to transmit Monies to Chamberlain, Penalty £5.
Duty of 5s. on Admission to Freedom.
Wines imported into London, 4s. per Ton.
Qu. If this Duty repealed by 27 G. III. c.. 13. §1.
Duty and Metage upon Coals brought into London for 50 Years.
When recovered, paid into the Chamber.

The Duty on Coals continued by. 21 G. II. c. 29—7 G. III. c. 37. § 38. and by 44 G. III. c. xxvii. §11. continued from 24th June 1831, to which it had been continued by. 7 G. III. c.37. §38. until 5th July 1837.
Officers of Receipt to give Security.
On the Determination of the said Duty, the City Lands charged with £6,000 per Ann. more.
Application of the said Monies, Salaries, &c.
Provision hereby made declared to be a full Discharge of the Debt due from the City to the Orphans and other Creditors.
Regulations for keeping Books, Accompts, &c. by Chamberlain.
Chamberlain misapplying Money. See 7 G. III. c. 37. §64.
Chamberlain to give a Note of principal Debt—Transferable.
No Person compellable to pay Money belonging to Orphans into the Chamber.
Corporation Revenues charged for Misapplication by Mayor, &c.
Fines, &c. upon the Mayor, &c. cannot be acquitted.
Orphans hereafter may take Advantage of this Act, and Mayor, &c. may order the Chamberlain to pay on Notice.
Persons to whom Monies paid to give a Discharge.
Orphans that have transferred may redeem in Three Years.
Interest at £8 per Cent. per Ann.
Proviso for New River, York Buildings, Shadwell, and London Bridge Water Companies.
—Hutchinson, he paying his Share in Convex Lights.
In Actions for executing Act, General Issue, Treble Costs.
Money retained for City Charges, not exceeding £2,000 yearly.

To be repaid, and City Lands charged with Repayment; Exception of certain Hospitals.
This Act recited, and the Funds thereby created further charged, 7 G.III.c. 37. § 7—18 G.III.c.48. § 1.— c.49. § 6.—c.50. § 5.—c. 51. § 5.—c. 72. § 11.—35 G.III.c. 126.—38 G.III.c.lxi. —39 & 40 G.III.c. xlii.—42 G. III.c. lxxiii.—44 G.III.c.xxvii. which is revived and continued by 49 G.III.c.lxxxii. and see 51 G.III.c.cciii.—55 G.III.c.xci. and c.xciii
See Leather. Papists. Village. Weekly Bills of Mortality.

head.key: Lords Commissioners of the Great Seal

tr.td: Commissioners of the Great Seal may execute the Office and take the Emoluments of the Lord Chancellor.

One Commissioner may hear Motions, &c. but not make Decrees, &c.
As to the Authorities, Jurisdictions, and Powers vested in the Lord Chancellor and Lord Keeper, see 28 E.I.c.5—15 R. II. c. 12.—17 R. II. c. 6.—14 & 15 H. VIII. c.2. § 9.—27 H. VIII. c. 11. § 9. and the Authority of the Lord Chancellor and the Lord Keeper declared to be one, 5 Eliz.c. 18.

entry.head: Low Wines and Strong Waters See Ercise.
